005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.format;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.node.IAssemblyInstanceGroupedNodeItem;
009import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.node.IAssemblyNodeItem;
010import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.node.IDocumentNodeItem;
011import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.node.IFieldNodeItem;
012import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.node.IFlagNodeItem;
013import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.node.IModuleNodeItem;
014import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.node.IRootAssemblyNodeItem;
015
016import java.util.stream.Collectors;
017
018import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
019
020/**
021 * This interface provides an implementation contract for all path formatters.
022 * When {@link #format(IPathSegment)} is called on a formatter implementation,
023 * the formatter will render the path segments based on the implemented path
024 * syntax. This allows a collection of path segments to be rendered in different
025 * forms by swapping out the formatter used.
026 *
027 * A path formatter is expected to be stateless and thus thread safe.
028 */
029public interface IPathFormatter {
030  /**
031   * A path formatter that produces Metapath-based paths.
032   */
033  @NonNull
034  IPathFormatter METAPATH_PATH_FORMATER = new MetapathFormatter();
035
036  /**
037   * Format the path represented by the provided path segment. The provided
038   * segment is expected to be the last node in this path. A call to
039   * {@link IPathSegment#getPathStream()} or {@link IPathSegment#getPath()} can be
040   * used to walk the path tree in descending order.
041   *
042   * @param segment
043   *          The last segment in a sequence of path segments
044   * @return a formatted path
045   * @see IPathSegment#getPathStream()
046   * @see IPathSegment#getPath()
047   */
048  @SuppressWarnings("null")
049  @NonNull
050  default String format(@NonNull IPathSegment segment) {
051    return segment.getPathStream().map(pathSegment -> {
052      return pathSegment.format(this);
053    }).collect(Collectors.joining("/"));
054  }
055
056  /**
057   * This visitor callback is used to format an individual flag path segment.
058   *
059   * @param flag
060   *          the node to format
061   * @return the formatted text for the segment
062   */
063  @NonNull
064  String formatFlag(@NonNull IFlagNodeItem flag);
065
066  /**
067   * This visitor callback is used to format an individual field path segment.
068   *
069   * @param field
070   *          the node to format
071   * @return the formatted text for the segment
072   */
073  @NonNull
074  String formatField(@NonNull IFieldNodeItem field);
075
076  /**
077   * This visitor callback is used to format an individual assembly path segment.
078   *
079   * @param assembly
080   *          the node to format
081   * @return the formatted text for the segment
082   */
083  @NonNull
084  String formatAssembly(@NonNull IAssemblyNodeItem assembly);
085
086  /**
087   * This visitor callback is used to format an individual grouped assembly path
088   * segment.
089   *
090   * @param assembly
091   *          the node to format
092   * @return the formatted text for the segment
093   */
094  @NonNull
095  String formatAssembly(@NonNull IAssemblyInstanceGroupedNodeItem assembly);
096
097  /**
098   * This visitor callback is used to format a root assembly path segment.
099   *
100   * @param root
101   *          the node to format
102   * @return the formatted text for the segment
103   */
104  @NonNull
105  String formatRootAssembly(@NonNull IRootAssemblyNodeItem root);
106
107  /**
108   * This visitor callback is used to format an individual document path segment.
109   *
110   * @param document
111   *          the node to format
112   * @return the formatted text for the segment
113   */
114  @NonNull
115  String formatDocument(@NonNull IDocumentNodeItem document);
116
117  /**
118   * This visitor callback is used to format an individual metaschema path
119   * segment.
120   *
121   * @param metaschema
122   *          the node to format
123   * @return the formatted text for the segment
124   */
125  @NonNull
126  String formatMetaschema(@NonNull IModuleNodeItem metaschema);
127}
